A bull rush attempts to push an opponent straight back without doing any harm. If your {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} is successful, your target is pushed back 5 feet. For every 5 by which your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} exceeds your opponent's {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}, you can push the target back an additional 5 feet.
An enemy being moved by a bull rush does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} because of the movement unless you possess the Greater Bull Rush {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. You cannot bull rush a creature into a square that is occupied by a solid object or obstacle.

d8ca5ba2-7c38-49ad-afc7-26899432c9aa:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} gives the character an ability to perform the bull rush {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. It also grants a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} when performing this maneuver, and a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against it.
A bull rush attempts to push an opponent straight back without doing any harm. If your combat maneuver is successful, your target is pushed back 5 feet. For every 5 by which your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} exceeds your opponent's CMD you can push the target back an additional 5 feet.
An enemy being moved by a bull rush does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} because of the movement unless you possess the Greater Bull Rush feat. You cannot bull rush a creature into a square that is occupied by a solid object or obstacle.
f74caddc-78f8-468e-8af6-371f8ab3b377:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} gives the character an ability to perform the dirty trick {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. It also grants a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} when performing this maneuver, and a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against it.
You can attempt to hinder a foe in melee as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. If your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} is successful, the target takes a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g}. The penalty is limited to one of the following conditions: blinded, entangled, or sickened.
This condition lasts for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. For every 5 by which your attack exceeds your opponent's CMD, the penalty lasts 1 additional round.
13d9f747-9c43-49e1-a50d-fed7695e8581:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} gives the character an ability to perform the disarm {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. It also grants a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} when performing this maneuver, and a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against it.
You can attempt to disarm a foe in melee as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. If your combat maneuver is successful, the target cannot use his weapons for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
For every 5 by which your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} exceeds your opponent's CMD, the disarmed condition lasts 1 additional round.
f5cda27a-2587-4978-bdba-74bb2beabe89:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} gives the character an ability to perform the sunder armor {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. It also grants a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} when performing this maneuver, and a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against it.
You can attempt to dislodge an armor worn by your opponent. If your combat maneuver is successful, the target loses its bonuses from armor for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
For every 5 by which your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} exceeds your opponent's CMD, the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} lasts 1 additional round.
294cdc6a-8d05-4977-b7ff-a1ac1d9a56be:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} gives the character an ability to perform the trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g}. It also grants a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:CMB}CMB{/g} when performing this maneuver, and a +2 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} when defending against it.
You can attempt to trip your opponent in place of a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. If your combat maneuver is successful, the target is knocked prone.
If the target has more than two legs, add +2 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the combat maneuver {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} for each additional leg it has. Some creatures â€” such as oozes, creatures without legs, and flying creatures â€” cannot be tripped.
1f7a5390-251b-4e57-9e8b-191c93b3c67a: Three times per day you can drink blood from an {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g}, sleeping or paralyzed living creatures. You can also drink blood from corpses of living creatures. Whenever you drink blood from such a creature, you gain 5 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} plus 5 for every three {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} you have and a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. The effects last 1 hour.
6f6a578a-bb11-4412-bb20-6e3eda3c4b6c: When an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against an opponent that you also {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threaten{/g}, you can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} against that opponent.
e8fde603-047a-43e7-874f-d88d1714d30d: When fighting defensively with at least one hand free, you gain a +4 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g}. If a melee attack misses you by 4 or less, you lose this dodge bonus until the beginning of your next turn.
72a6ed9d-f117-4caa-b587-7a8de22b8fb0: When making a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a ranged weapon, you can fire one additional time this {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} at your highest {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. All of your attack rolls take a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} when using Rapid Shot.
1e9f03fc-8552-44a8-9506-70553db0b741: When mounted and using the charge action, you deal double {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with melee weapons.
228f8c47-84c9-4976-a1a1-0e64ebb51d07: When using the weapon you selected, your threat range is doubled.
9b719aac-8250-4b31-ab76-e5f635c1dc3e:
When wielding a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}light weapon{/g} or any other weapon that can be used with Weapon Finesse, you can choose to take a â€“1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
This bonus to damage is halved (â€“50%) if you are making an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with an off-hand weapon or secondary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g}.
When your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} reaches +4, and for every 4 points thereafter, the penalty increases by â€“1 and the bonus on damage rolls increases by +2. You must choose to use this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} before the attack roll, and its effects last until your next turn. The bonus damage does not apply to {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or effects that do not deal hit point damage. This feat cannot be used in conjunction with the Power Attack feat.
4b7c860f-fee4-4982-a071-c917f7a15a51: When you are adjacent to one or more allies who also have this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} per such ally (maximum +4).

fc71d22c-7393-4bb3-8034-f99692ca1210:
When you score a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, you can apply the effects of two critical {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} in addition to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt.
Normal: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit in addition to the damage dealt.
32b17d2a-a716-48d1-ab65-28e26b37e0ec: When you use Cleave, you take a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} until your next turn.
c5d4ff8e-56d2-4f85-8c0a-7e5889144b20: When you use wild shape, it is supernaturally ferocious and disquieting in appearance, such that when you {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} a creature, you can use this ferocity to frighten observers. Whenever you make an attack, enemies within 30 feet of you must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) to resist being affected by your frightful shape. On a failed save, creatures with fewer HD than you become shaken, or frightened if they have 4 HD or fewer; in either case, the effect lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your character level. Creatures that succeed on their saving throw are immune to your frightful shape for 24 hours. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.
e8e26619-8993-407e-8c8e-842fa82c8714: Whenever you and an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} are {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} the same creature, you deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with each successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. 3d4db4eb-2ff5-4988-8bfe-284e3ed555c3: Whenever you and an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} are {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} the same creature, your flanking {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} increases to +4. 09984ae2-044d-4e44-bed2-6aa4ed9ba655: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g}. You call upon the spirit of dragonkind, gaining greater resilience, mobility, and fierceness from the blessing of these great beings.

0986ab45-3f84-4540-8b5e-ad6e6ab04942:

This condition lasts for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. For every 5 by which your attack exceeds your opponent's {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}, the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} lasts 1 additional round.

You can attempt to trip your opponent in place of a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. If your {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} is successful, the target is knocked prone.
If the target has more than two legs, add +2 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the combat maneuver {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} for each additional leg it has. Some creatures â€” such as oozes, creatures without legs, and flying creatures â€” cannot be tripped.
e06d8e73-f526-4b87-b9cd-870a232cc761:
You can cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} as if they were a higher level.
Benefit: A heightened spell has a higher spell level than normal (up to a maximum of 9th level). Unlike other metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, Heighten Spell actually increases the effective level of the spell that it modifies. All effects dependent on spell level (such as {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} DCs and ability to penetrate a lesser globe of invulnerability) are calculated according to the heightened level.
Level Increase: The heightened spell is as difficult to prepare and cast as a spell of its effective level.
fad2fbc0-ca04-4545-87d8-0cc185c76a80:
You can cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} in a fraction of the normal time.
Benefit: Casting a quickened spell is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. You can perform another {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, even casting another spell, in the same {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as you cast a quickened spell. A spell whose {g|Encyclopedia:Casting_Time}casting time{/g} is more than 1 round cannot be quickened.
Level Increase: +4 (A quickened spell uses up a spell slot four levels higher than the spell's actual level.)
Casting a quickened spell doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
Special: You can apply the effects of this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} to a spell cast spontaneously, so long as it has a casting time that is not more than 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, without increasing the spell's casting time.
b878d3a9-f746-4e5d-bf09-0e9961589c41:
You can choose to take a â€“1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
This bonus to damage is increased by half (+50%) if you are making an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon, a one handed weapon using two hands, or a primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} that adds 1-1/2 times your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier on damage rolls. This bonus to damage is halved (â€“50%) if you are making an attack with an off-hand weapon or secondary natural weapon.
When your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} reaches +4, and every 4 points thereafter, the penalty increases by â€“1 and the bonus to damage increases by +2.
The effects of this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} last until your next turn. The bonus damage does not apply to {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or effects that do not deal hit point damage.
532692ed-6b36-4e85-b002-ddfea7f2e984:
You can choose to take a â€“1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} rolls to gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all ranged {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
When your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} reaches +4, and every +4 thereafter, the penalty increases by â€“1 and the bonus to damage increases by +2. You must choose to use this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} before making an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} and its effects last until your next turn. The bonus damage does not apply to {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or effects that do not deal hit point damage.
bef773f2-b11b-47e5-88f9-8699472bf641: You can choose to take a â€“1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to gain a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. When your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} reaches +4, and every +4 thereafter, the penalty increases by â€“1 and the dodge bonus increases by +1. You can only choose to use this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} when you declare that you are making an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} or a full attack with a melee weapon. The effects of this feat last until your next turn.

You can increase the power of your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, causing them to deal more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
Benefit: All variable numeric effects of an empowered spell are increased by half including {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}.
{g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saving throws{/g} and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.
Level Increase: +2 (An empowered spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level.)
fefc27e5-1a4b-4f42-bb7d-40661ab65b30: You can increase the {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} of your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} by 5 feet until the end of your turn by taking a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until your next turn. This {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} does not stack with other penalties applied due to Crushing Blow.

Benefit: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can make one attack at your highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} that deals additional damage. {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} the weapon's damage dice for the attack three times and add the results together before adding {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} from {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, weapon abilities (such as flaming), precision-based damage, and other damage bonuses. These extra weapon damage dice are not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, but are added to the total.

You can modify a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} to become more tenacious when its targets resist its effect.
Benefit: Whenever a creature targeted by a persistent spell or within its area succeeds on its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against the spell, it must make another saving throw against the effect. If a creature fails this second saving throw, it suffers the full effects of the spell, as if it had failed its first saving throw.
Level Increase: +2 (A persistent spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level.)
Spells that do not require a saving throw to resist or lessen the spell's effect do not benefit from this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.

You gain a new {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}, each usable twice per day, from the following list, in order:
1. vanish
2. sleep
3. blur
4. invisibility
5. deep slumber
6. displacement
7. confusion
8. dominate person.
For example, the first time you select this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you gain vanish 2/day; the second time you select this feat, you gain sleep 2/day. Your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} for these {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} is equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}. The DCs for these abilities are {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}-based.
You may select this feat up to eight times. Each time you take it, you gain an additional ability as described above.

Benefit: You gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g} rolls for each ally with this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} who made a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} since the end of your last turn against a target within 15 feet of your target, to a maximum of +4.
de38a457-9e2f-4a6f-8952-614d859d0369:
You know how to work together to trip your foes.
Benefit: Whenever you attempt a trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} against an enemy {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened{/g} by an ally with this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the better result.
c5c862a1-fa32-460b-8a7a-e0160418ab6e:
You know just where to strike to temporarily stun a foe.
You must use this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} before you make your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} (thus, a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). Stunning Fist forces a foe {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} by your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attack{/g} to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wis{/g} modifier), in addition to dealing damage normally. A defender who fails this saving throw is stunned for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (until just before your next turn). A stunned character drops everything held, can't take {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, loses any {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and takes a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to AC. You may attempt a stunning attack once per day for every four levels you have attained, and no more than once per round. Constructs, oozes, plants, undead, {g|Encyclopedia:Incorporeal_Touch_Attack}incorporeal{/g} creatures, and creatures immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} cannot be stunned.
d81d0356-961d-4e4f-b4a2-886dc5e154af:
You make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that deals significantly more {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} than normal.
Benefit: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can make one attack at your highest {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} that deals additional damage. {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}Roll{/g} the weapon's damage dice for the attack twice and add the results together before adding {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} from {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, weapon abilities (such as flaming), precision-based damage, and other damage bonuses. These extra weapon damage dice are not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, but are added to the total.
c97314d5-0f3e-49c8-a501-d6c0d13b96ea:
You make your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} deal additional area of effect {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, while making them stronger.
Benefit: Spell now deals 2 more points of damage per dice {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolled{/g} to all its targets. Additionally, all enemies in 5 feet of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Target}spell targets{/g} are dealt 2 damage per dice rolled of the original spell. The spell can no longer apply precision damage.
Level Increase: +1 (A bolstered spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.)
0384b72b-683c-4b31-b88a-aacbfb40528d: You may add your base shield {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (including the bonus from Shield Focus but not including enhancement bonuses) to your mount's {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
49bc1243-73f8-44aa-9e50-d0280c91c9fb:
You may {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with light and heavy shields. This incurs standard {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} for two-weapon fighting if you have a weapon in your other hand.
A light shield deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and is considered a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}light weapon{/g}. A heavy shield deals 1d6 damage and is considered a one-handed weapon.
ca3ba542-a15c-4146-af85-33a9f4753a3b:
You must declare that you are using this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} before you make your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} (thus a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). You can {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} your attack roll twice and take the higher result. You may attempt a perfect attack once per day for every four levels you have attained (but see Special).
Special: A zen archer or quarterstaff master monk receives Perfect Strike as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. A monk may attempt an perfect strike attack a number of times per day equal to his monk level, plus one more time per day for every four levels he has in classes other than monk.

This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Sunder Armor. Whenever you successfully perform a sunder, the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} lasts for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, plus 1 round for every 5 by which your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} exceeds the target's {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}.
f0d27ea3-1dc1-4896-9f71-04ce5b3dbb4c: You receive a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to bull rush a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Bull Rush. Whenever you bull rush an opponent, his movement provokes {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} from you and all of your allies.
27d8c5ad-d045-4c6b-a537-e52551e5388f: You receive a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overrun a foe. You also receive a +2 bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g} whenever an opponent tries to overrun you.
7cf5a567-6c01-4236-aaf6-cc68fa46eb99: You receive a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g} whenever an opponent tries to trip you.
7de749e1-e48f-4125-9ec7-7ca73713fa9f: You receive a +8 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g} whenever an opponent tries to trip you.
14b5c109-1b62-4450-aa0a-4d5422e6e80d:
You take only a â€“1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} for fighting defensively.
Whenever you lose the dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} from Crane Wing because an attack missed you by 4 or less, the enemy provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
469ad44c-f0fc-47ca-8464-6abd2a25c8c6: You take only a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} for fighting defensively. While using this style and fighting defensively, you gain an additional +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}.
b06b386c-092f-4e01-bf24-00727fdfe963:
You use the momentum of your movement to focus and awaken your inner beast.
Once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, when you move at least 10 feet or when you charge, you can use your wild shape ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}.
778c8cd7-8152-4888-8bc9-64671d0df70a:
You use your shapechanging powers to make your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} especially lethal.
Whenever you use the Weapon Finesse {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} to make a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with your claws or a natural {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} augmented by your claws, and you use your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus on attack rolls and your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, you also add half your shifter level to the damage.
7eb07838-fac8-485b-908d-9dcbc900264b:
You {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with the strength of a dragon, your telling blows striking fear into your enemies.
While using Dragon Style, increase your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} by an additional one-half your Strength bonus, to a total of double your Strength bonus on the first attack and 1.5 times your Strength bonus on the other attacks.
When you score a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or a successful Stunning Fist attempt against an opponent while using this style, that opponent is also shaken for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} + your Strength bonus.
9e4d4b4a-40ec-4dea-a2d0-dcab4b92668d:
Your allies cover you while you cast complicated {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
Benefit: Whenever you are adjacent to an ally who also has this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +4 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}.
If your ally is wielding a buckler or a light shield, this bonus increases by +1.
If your ally is wielding a heavy shield or a tower shield, this bonus increases by +2.
8c7be090-a7a9-4765-b1b4-44bdb70b6832:
Your allies need not fear friendly fire.
Benefit: When casting a selective {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with an area effect and a duration of instantaneous, you can choose a number of targets in the area equal to the {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} modifier used to determine bonus spells of the same type ({g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} for bards, oracles, paladins, sorcerers, and summoners; {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} for witches and wizards; {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} for clerics, druids, inquisitors, and rangers). These targets are excluded from the effects of your spell.
Level Increase: +1 (A selective spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.)
Spells that do not have an area of effect or a duration of instantaneous do not benefit from this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
2ac001a4-559e-46c1-9a3b-163fd3ee02bd:
Your ally's eyes are your own, and yours are his.
Benefit: While you are {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g} and adjacent to an ally with this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you receive a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} from opponents flanking you.
264a33ce-985d-4b4a-b64d-753374105d30:
Your claws cause bleeding wounds.
Whenever you deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing{/g} or slashing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, in addition to the damage dealt by the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponent takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of bleed damage at the start of their turn each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Bleed damage can be stopped with any magical {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g}.
dfdaf9f9-414a-4064-9e56-5de83054502a:
Your familiarity with a specific type of armor increases the amount of protection you receive from it.
Benefit(s): Select one type of armor. The {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} granted by the selected armor increases by 1.
5e091346-3cb0-4e7d-b7ef-ba507b8f9f2e:
Your wild shape form gains the benefits of one energy type for both offensive and defensive purposes.
Benefit: When you assume a wild shape form, choose one of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. You gain resistance 10 to that energy type. Also, your {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the chosen energy type. If you assume a wild shape form that already has {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} of the same type you choose, it increases by 5 instead. If you assume a wild shape form that deals damage of the same energy type you choose, the {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} your wild shape form deals increases by one damage die category (for example, a 1d6 becomes a 1d8) in addition to the extra damage.
f4ee2127-c734-4843-9195-58a20db48ae0:
Your {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} with your chosen weapon leaves opponents unable to defend themselves if you strike them when their defenses are already compromised.
Benefit: Any shaken, frightened, or panicked opponent hit by you this {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} is {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} until the end of your next turn. This includes any additional attacks you make this round.
aab3ebd4-9c62-41b6-afa3-9892a846460b:
Your {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} with your favored weapon can frighten enemies.
Benefit: While wielding the weapon in which you have Weapon Focus, you can perform a bewildering show of prowess as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}. Make a {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} (intimidate) {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} to demoralize all foes within 30 feet who can see your display.
3eb54b81-5f42-450d-8cfb-e0c15defd2bb:
Your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} go farther than normal.
Benefit: You can alter a spell with a range of {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g}, close, or medium to increase its range by one range category, using the following order: touch, close, medium, and long.
Level Increase: +1 (A reach spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.)
Spells modified by this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} that require melee touch {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} instead require ranged touch attacks.
Spells that do not have a range of touch, close, or medium do not benefit from this feat.
02a2c861-b34d-4890-9cc4-b4ca2c9691e4:
Your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} have the maximum possible effect.
Benefit: All variable, numeric effects of a spell modified by this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} are maximized. {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Saving throws{/g} and opposed {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.
Level Increase: +3 (A maximized spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual level.)
An empowered, maximized spell gains the separate benefits of each feat: the maximum result plus half the normally rolled result.
6cb7db60-215a-47e3-8c7c-ece127c7b460:
Your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} of a certain element are more difficult to resist.
Benefit: Choose one energy type (acid, cold, electricity, or fire). Add +1 to the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}Difficulty Class{/g} for all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against spells that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of the energy type you select.
